description:
Application for a Minor Material Amendment (S73) to vary conditions 2 (Approved Plans) and 7 (Accessibility Part M4(2) of Building Regulations), and remove condition 8 (Accessibility  Part M4(3) of Building Regulations) of planning permission 160612FUL dated 19/10/2016 for Construction of a four storey building with basement, to provide ten self-contained flats ( 1x1 bed, 8x2 bed and 1 x 3 bed), with sunken patios at basement level, terraces at ground and third floor levels and associated landscaping, refuse storage provision)
(Amendments seek to reduce the requirement from 90 percent to 30 percent of accessible and adaptable dwellings and to remove the requirement that 10 percent are wheelchair user accessible)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of planning permission 160612FUL dated 19/10/2016.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers Location Plan as Proposed - 203, Proposed Plans - P500 Rev D, Minor Amendment Application Proposed Elevations - P510 Rev F, Proposed Materials Schedule - V3.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding the approved plans, materials for the external surfaces of the development shall be in accordance with the "Proposed Materials Schedule Version 3" as submitted and approved via this notice. Development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Adopted Development Plan Document (2013), 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (consolidated 2015), policies 1.1(g)(h)(k), 1.2(g), 2.1(c) of the Ealing Development (core) Strategy 2012. | The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until the refuse and recycling storage facilities shown on the approved plans have been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times, unless alternative arrangements are approved in writing by the local planning authority.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.2 (i) of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, policy 7A of the Adopted Development Plan Document (2013) and policies 5.16 and 5.17 of the London Plan (consolidated 2015). | The remediation of the site shall be carried out in accordance with the verification report (reference P881443/J4643/sl) submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority under application 172097CND dated 16/03/2016.

In the event that contamination is found at any time when carrying out the approved development that was not previously identified it must be reported in writing immediately to the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: In the interests of health and safety, in accordance with policy 5.21, 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Plan Document (2013), policy 5.21 of the London Plan (consolidated 2015) and policy 1.1(j)  of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012). | The development hereby approved shall not be brought into use until the surplus crossover along its frontage providing access into the site has been removed and the pavement and kerb at this location re-instated.

Reason: In pursuance to highway user's safety in accordance with policies 1.1(e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and policies 6.13, 6.3 and 8.2 the London Plan (consolidated 2015). | 30% of the approved residential dwellings shall be designed and constructed to meet Approved Document M (Volume 1: Dwellings), Part M4 (2)(Accessible and adaptable dwellings) of Building Regulations 2015, or other such relevant technical requirements in use at the time of the construction of the development.

Reason:  To ensure that the development is adaptable, flexible, convenient and appropriate to the changing needs of the future occupiers, in accordance with policies 3.5, 3.8 and 3.9 of the London Plan 2015; and policy 1.1(h) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2012. | Prior to the first occupation of the dwellings, the approved domestic units shall incorporate and maintain sustainability measures in line with the Sustainability and Energy Statement (27 May 2016) Rev 0, prepared by Metropolis Green.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2015, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012. | Prior to the first occupation of the dwellings, the approved domestic units shall incorporate and maintain Ultra low-NOx boilers gas boilers for the provision of the space heating and hot water requirements with dry NOx Emissions below 40 mg/kWh as stated in the Sustainability Report Issue 3 prepared by Bespoke Builder Services Ltd (March 2016) and Ealing_Schedule of Response to Ealing's Energy Comments (July 2016).

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3 of the London Plan 2015, policies LV5.2 of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG, April 2014. | Prior to the final completion of all dwellings of the development, the approved dwellings shall incorporate measures to achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 35.5% (equal to 4.4 tonnes CO2/yr) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 through the following carbon emission savings as detailed in the approved Sustainability and Energy Statement Rev 0 (27 May 2016) and additional information (July 2016), all prepared by Metropolis Green:

a) energy saving measures to achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 2.3 tonnes CO2 equating to 18.8% CO2 emissions reduction in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the compliant BR Part L 2013 baseline

b) incorporation of solar PV technology with a total capacity of 4.66kWp to supply at least 4 MWh of electricity annually and achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 2.1 tonnes CO2 equating to 20.6% in carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions reduction over the Be Lean stage of the Energy Hierarchy.

Within three-months of the first occupation of the new dwellings, Energy Performance Certificates, Accompany Advisory Reports and detailed SAP modelling output reports showing clearly the DER and TER for each unit from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

Reason:  To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2015 (with FALP 2011/REMA 2013), policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.
